questions.question: Which definition BEST describes a service?
options: A way to deliver value to customers by facilitating outcomes customers want to achieve without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks
A performance measurement that demonstrates the continual improvement of an IT department
A function of an organization that consists of people, processes, and technology
A collection of resources designed to complete various tasks as requested by the customer

questions.question: What is a 'warranty' in service management?
options: A legally binding agreement that services will meet expectations
Assurance that a product or service will meet agreed requirements
A contract that can be used in case of service failure
A document that describes acceptable service downtime

questions.question: Which statement BEST describes the key focus of service relationship management?
options: Establishing mechanisms to collect customer feedback about services
Identifying and managing third-party suppliers that provide services
Establishing and nurturing links between the organization and its stakeholders
Developing procedures for handling service complaints

questions.question: What term describes 'A possible event that could cause harm or loss, or make it more difficult to achieve objectives'?
Which ITIL guiding principle emphasizes using existing services, processes, and tools?
Which guiding principle recommends making gradual improvements with frequent validation?
Which guiding principle focuses on making work visible and working together?
When considering the 'Optimize and automate' guiding principle, what should be done FIRST?
options: Simplify and organize work before automating

questions.question: Which of the four dimensions of service management is concerned with workflow coordination and controls?
Which of the four dimensions of service management focuses on skills, competencies, roles, and responsibilities?
Which of the four dimensions of service management considers contracts and agreements with third parties?
Which component of the ITIL service value system provides a structured approach for organizations to determine improvements at all levels?
Which service value chain activity ensures that products and services continually meet stakeholder expectations for quality, costs, and time to market?
Which service value chain activity provides a good understanding of stakeholder needs, transparency, and continual engagement?
Which service value chain activity ensures services meet agreed specifications?
What is the primary purpose of the incident management practice?
options: To reduce the likelihood of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents
To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible
To develop workarounds for known errors
To fulfill service requests from users

questions.question: What is the purpose of the problem management practice?
options: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To support the agreed quality of a service by handling all pre-defined, user-initiated service requests
To reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents
To ensure services deliver the performance agreed with the business customer

questions.question: What is a known error in ITIL?
options: A mistake made by a service desk analyst when logging an incident
A problem that has been analyzed but not resolved
An incident for which a root cause has not been identified
A problem that has been analyzed and has a documented root cause and workaround

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the service desk practice?
options: To analyze the root cause of incidents and provide workarounds
To authorize changes to service components
To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
To ensure services are delivered according to agreed targets

questions.question: Which practice ensures that accurate and reliable information about the configurations of services is available when and where it is needed?
What is the MAIN purpose of the change enablement practice?
options: To ensure all changes are logged in the configuration management database
To ensure changes are deployed successfully into production environments
To maximize the number of successful IT changes implemented
To ensure that risks are properly assessed and that changes are authorized and implemented in a controlled manner

questions.question: Which practice is BEST described as the practice that identifies the current state of assets and the means to ensure that they remain operational?
What is the purpose of the monitoring and event management practice?
options: To ensure service requests from users are fulfilled
To detect changes in state that have significance for the management of IT services
To restore normal service operation after an incident
To analyze and report on collected data to inform decision-making

questions.question: What is an incident in ITIL?
options: An unplanned interruption to a service or reduction in the quality of a service
A cause of one or more incidents
A cause of one or more problems
A request from a user for information, advice, or for a standard change

questions.question: What is the purpose of the service level management practice?
options: To ensure all service requests are handled efficiently
To ensure that services achieve their expected outcomes
To set clear business-based targets for service performance
To create a continual feedback loop to drive improvement initiatives

questions.question: What is a configuration item?
options: Any component of a product required for the product to function correctly
Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service
An item of hardware, software, documentation, or other component procured rather than developed
A component of the IT infrastructure procured from third-party vendors

questions.question: What is the purpose of the continual improvement practice?
options: To align the organization's practices and services with changing business needs through the ongoing improvement of services, practices, or any element involved in managing services
To ensure that changes to configuration items are properly planned and authorized
To protect information needed by the organization to conduct its business
To set targets and measure performance for services

questions.question: Which step of the Continual Improvement Model asks 'Where are we now?'
options: Where do we want to be?

questions.question: What is the purpose of the service request management practice?
options: To handle service disruptions and restore normal service operation
To support the agreed quality of a service by handling all pre-defined, user-initiated service requests
To establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders
To manage and control the way new or changed components are deployed to live environments

questions.question: Which practice is responsible for moving new or changed hardware, software, documentation, processes, or any other component to live environments?
What is the main purpose of information security management practice?
options: To protect information assets from unauthorized access
To ensure backup and recovery processes are working
To create information classification policies and standards
To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business

questions.question: What is the purpose of relationship management practice?
options: To manage supplier performance and contracts
To establish and nurture links between the organization and its stakeholders
To manage services provided by third parties
To identify customer requirements for services

questions.question: Which practice has the purpose of ensuring that the organization's suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately to support the provision of seamless quality products and services?
Which is a key activity of the service desk practice?
options: Investigating the root cause of incidents
Logging and managing incidents and service requests
Authorizing changes to the IT infrastructure

questions.question: What is the definition of utility in the context of service value?
options: The functionality offered by a product or service to meet a particular need
The total cost of using a service, including the purchase price
The assurance that a product or service will meet agreed requirements
The level of support provided for a particular service

questions.question: Which term refers to the individuals responsible for authorizing budget for service consumption?
Which practice is responsible for making new and changed services and features available for use?
Which guiding principle emphasizes the direct and indirect costs of service provision?
Which component of the ITIL service value system represents activities undertaken by the organization to deliver products and services?
